questions: Who were ‘liberals’?
answers: Liberals were a group of people who wanted a nation which tolerates all religions. They also opposed the uncontrolled power of dynastic rulers.

questions: Who were called ‘radicals’?
answers: Radicals were the ones, who wanted a nation in which government was based on the majority of a country’s population. They opposed the privileges of great landowners and wealthy factory owners.

questions: What were the ideals of ‘Conservatives’?
answers: They were opposed to radicals and liberals. They believed that the past had to be respected and change had to be brought about through a slow process.

questions: Give one characteristic of a socialist.
answers: Socialists are against private property and saw it as the root of all social ills of the time.

questions: Who was Robert Owen?
answers: Robert Owen was a leading English manufacturer who sought to build a cooperative community called New Harmony in Indiana (USA).

questions: Name two famous socialists who introduced a communist system.
answers: Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels.

questions: What was a communist society according to Karl Marx?
answers: Marx believed that to free themselves from capitalist exploitation, workers had to construct a radically socialist society where all property was socially controlled.

questions: Name the socialist international body which coordinated their efforts.
answers: The Second International

questions: What is ‘Russian Revolution’?
answers: The fall of monarchy in February 1917 and the events of October are normally called the Russian Revolution.

questions: Which territories were included in Russian Empire?
answers: Russian Empire included current day Finland, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia, parts of Poland, Ukraine and Belarus. It also included today’s central Asian states as Georgia, Armenia and Azerbaijan.

questions: Name the socialist party formed in Russia in 1898 on Marx’s ideas.
answers: The Russian Social Democratic Workers Party.

questions: What role was played by ‘The Socialist Revolutionary Party’ in 1900 Russia?
answers: This party struggled for peasants’ rights and demanded that land belonging to nobles be transferred to peasants.

questions: What was the demand of workers of St. Petersberg in 1904?
answers: The workers went on a strike demanding a reduction in the working day to eight hours, an increase in wages and improvement in working conditions.

questions: Which incident was the immediate cause of 1905 Revolution in Russia?
answers: ‘Bloody Sunday’ was the incident, where over 100 workers were killed and above 300 wounded on a Sunday.

questions: What was a ‘Duma’?
answers: ‘Duma’ was a Parliament of elected consultative formed with the permission of Tsar after the success of 1905 Russian Revolution.

questions: Name the leader who led procession of workers to winter palace.
answers: Father Gapon.

questions: Name the countries that formed allied Powers in World War I.
answers: France, Britain and Russia. Later, Italy and Romania too joined them.

questions: Which countries formed central Powers bloc during World War I?
answers: Germany, Austria, Hungary and Turkey.

questions: What was ‘Soviet’?
answers: ‘Soviet’ was a council of soldiers and striking workers of Russia.

questions: What was ‘Petrograd Soviet’?
answers: When Soviet met in the same building where ‘Duma’ met, it was named as ‘Petrograd Soviet’.

questions: What was the result of February Revolution of 1917 in Russia?
answers: It brought down monarchy and Duma leaders and soviet leaders formed a provisional government.

questions: What was Lenin’s ‘April Theses’?
answers: The three demands of Lenin were called ‘April Thesis’. They were to be closed, land to the tillers and banks to be nationalised.

questions: What new name was given to ‘Bolshevik Party’?
answers: ‘The Communist Party’

questions: Who was the Prime Minister of Russia when October Revolution began?
answers: Kerenskii.

questions: Which secret police was formed to punish the one who criticised Bolsheviks?
answers: The secret police called ‘Cheka’ first and later OGPU and NKVD.

questions: What was Centralised Planning?
answers: A process of centralised planning was introduced by Bolsheviks. In it the officials assessed how the economy could work and set targets for a five year period called ‘Five Year Plans’.

questions: Who was Stalin?
answers: Stalin was a close associate of Lenin and came to power in Russia after Lenin’s death. He introduced firm emergency measures.

questions: Who were ‘kulaks’?
answers: It was the name given to the well-to-do peasants of Russia.

questions: Why Kulaks needed to be eliminated?
answers: To develop modern forms and run them along industrial lives with machinery, it was necessary to eliminate Kulaks, take away land from peasants and establish state controlled large farms.

questions: What does ‘Kolkhoz’ mean?
answers: These were collective farms. Peasants worked on this land and the profit is shared amongst them. Those who resisted collectivisation were severely punished.

questions: What is Comintern?
answers: It is Communist International, a union of pro—Bolshevik Socialist parties.
